channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Storage Virtualize
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Storage Virtualize

item.title: CVE-2023-43042|2024-08-02T19:37:23.491Z -- ibm -- storage%20virtualize
item.description: IBM SAN Volume Controller, IBM Storwize, IBM FlashSystem and IBM Storage Virtualize 8.3 products use default passwords for a privileged user. IBM X-Force ID: 266874.

item.title: CVE-2024-39723|2024-08-02T04:26:16.072Z -- ibm -- storage%20virtualize
item.description: IBM FlashSystem 5300 USB ports may be usable even if the port has been disabled by the administrator. A user with physical access to the system could use the USB port to cause loss of access to data. IBM X-Force ID: 295935.

item.title: CVE-2024-39723|2024-07-08T00:38:47.786Z -- ibm -- storage%20virtualize
item.description: IBM FlashSystem 5300 USB ports may be usable even if the port has been disabled by the administrator. A user with physical access to the system could use the USB port to cause loss of access to data. IBM X-Force ID: 295935.

item.title: CVE-2023-47700|2024-02-07T16:20:32.473Z -- ibm -- storage%20virtualize
item.description: IBM SAN Volume Controller, IBM Storwize, IBM FlashSystem and IBM Storage Virtualize 8.6 products could allow a remote attacker to spoof a trusted system that would not be correctly validated by the Storwize server. This could lead to a user connecting to a malicious host, believing that it was a trusted system and deceived into accepting spoofed data. IBM X-Force ID: 271016.

item.title: CVE-2024-39723|2024-07-08T13:38:50.715Z -- ibm -- storage%20virtualize
item.description: IBM FlashSystem 5300 USB ports may be usable even if the port has been disabled by the administrator. A user with physical access to the system could use the USB port to cause loss of access to data. IBM X-Force ID: 295935.
